label: affricate
description: A [consonant](#consonant) sound made up of a [plosive](#plosive) and a [fricative](#fricative) pronounced simultaneously, together behaving within a language's [phonology](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/phonology) as if one single consonant. English has the affricates /t͡ʃ/, as in _church_, and /d͡ʒ/, as in _judge_. Some languages are known to distinguish affricates from an otherwise-identical sequence of a plosive followed by a fricative, such as Polish [_czy_](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/czy#Polish) /t͡ʂɘ/ vs. [_trzy_](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/trzy#Polish) /tʂɘ/.

label: phoneme
description: An indivisible unit of sound in a given language, an abstraction of the physical speech sounds.

label: consonant
description: Any sound that is not the dominant sound of a syllable, the dominant sound generally being a vowel.

label: vowel
description: A speech sound produced by a comparatively open configuration of the vocal tract.

label: semivowel
description: A speech sound that is phonetically similar to a vowel sound, but functions as the boundary of a syllable rather than as the nucleus of a syllable. Also termed a glide.

label: oxytone
description: With the stress upon the final syllable.

label: paroxytone
description: With the stress upon the penultimate (second to last) syllable.

label: proparoxytone
description: With the stress upon the antepenultimate (third to last) syllable.

label: apparent proparoxytone
description: A word ending in an unstressed diphthong that can be pronounced as either paroxytone or proparoxytone.

label: bis-esdruxula
description: A word tonicly accented on the syllable before the antepenultimate.

label: apheresis
description: The loss of one or more sounds from the beginning of a word.

label: apocope
description: The loss of one or more sounds from the end of a word.

label: syncope
description: The loss of one or more sounds from the interior of a word.

label: fortition
description: A consonant change in which a sound becomes "stronger" or more constricted.

label: lenition
description: A consonant change in which a sound becomes "weaker" or less constricted.

label: epenthesis
description: The addition of one or more sounds to a word, especially to the interior of a word.

label: anaptyxis
description: The insertion of a vowel between two consonants to aid pronunciation.
